Posted By: PaladinOfSunhome (9/16/2009 12:43:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nowadays that we have Jund and Golgari, getting to sacrifice a creature every turn can actually be quite an *advantage*. Plus, you get a giant flying, trampling 7/7 demon. I know that it's not the best card (Or even close to Akroma's equal), but I think it deserves a better rating than it has right now (the new art alone is worth 3 stars!). And at least when he deals 7 to you, he doesn't tap like some other demons.  
  
Try him with [Dragon Appeasement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Appeasement) and [Golgari Germination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Germination) for some fun. :)
posts.html:
Nowadays that we have Jund and Golgari, getting to sacrifice a creature every turn can actually be quite an advantage. Plus, you get a giant flying, trampling 7/7 demon. I know that it's not the best card (Or even close to Akroma's equal), but I think it deserves a better rating than it has right now (the new art alone is worth 3 stars!). And at least when he deals 7 to you, he doesn't tap like some other demons.

Try him with Dragon Appeasement and Golgari Germination for some fun. :)

Posted By: Weretarrasque (9/27/2009 8:10:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: He was never super amazing - He was always a little costly - he's 7 mana + the breeding pit combo which cost 4 and needs another 2 mana each turn, plus the sacrifice and if you fail that? - you suck on 7 damage! Wasps and serpents cost even more... Surely with that much mana/costs involved, there are easier and better combos to use. But if the combo did hit the floor -?- then it was definitely a bad scene for everyone else. Needless to say, he's a little expensive by today's standards.

posts.post_content:
I'm sorry, maybe there are better cards out there, but this is some of the coolest artwork I've ever seen. That guy is so bad-\*\*\* looking... and the flavor text is awesome. He has his drawbacks, but for long-time Magic players, it is great to see this behemoth back on the table.
  
   
5/5 Thanks WoTC!

Lord of the Pit could have gotten another great facelift when he was reintroduced in Tenth edition. People voted, and somehow the dancing demon that appeared on the card won over some very cool-looking art by Dave Alsop. Visit

 to see his amazing sketch. Click "Click here to reveal your choice" at the bottom of the page to see it.
